purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 寺 [ sì ] court, office; temple, monastery
heisig_chinese_memo: A poem is a temple of words.
heisig_constituent: poem, say, words, keitai, mouth, Buddhist temple, soil, dirt, ground, glue
heisig_story: Since silence is treasured so highly at a Buddhist temple the words spoken there must be well-chosen. Perhaps this is why the records of the monks often read to us like poems. Before going on, back up a frame and make sure you have kept poem and recitation distinct in your mind.
koohiiStory1: A poem is a temple of words.
koohiiStory2: WORDS used in a TEMPLE must be very well chosen. That´s why most people will speak using a poem if they are SAYING something in a TEMPLE.
jp_example_words:
詩(し): poem, verse of poetry
詩人(しじん): poet
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: What you say at a temple is a poem. It has to be a poem, because if you say anything else it's just plain disrespectful. All of the monks and priests at this temple have to read and recite poems all day, and if they can do it forever, you can while you're visiting.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture all of the people at the temple reciting poems together. You join in too, and it's a really powerful moment!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you recite a long poem at the temple you see a sheep (し) in the crowd. It's opening and closing its mouth like it wants to say the poem too.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
You turn to the person next to you and realize you have to say everything in poem form.
Excuse me
I'm not a creep
so hear my plea
is that a sheep?
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 詞 (シ часть речи, слово), 誌 (シ журнал).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the words (言) in the temple (寺) are poetry
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: At this buddhist temple the most popular way to word something is in the form of a poem.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " words " to " temple " sounds. The characters of Chu in the Warring States Period are different from " yan " and " zhi ", which are the same as the ancient text of "Shuowen". There are also glyphs from " kou " and " zhi ". The original meaning is poetry, a literary genre that expresses emotions through language with rhythm and rhythm. "Said Wen": "Poetry, will also. Congyan, temple sound. 𧥳, ancient poetry province." Duan Yucai quoted "Mao Poetry Preface" saying: "Poets, where the will is also. The heart is the will. Speaking is poetry." An example is "Shang Shu. "Jin Fei": "Gong is a poem to Yi Wang, the name is "Owl"." "Shanghai Bo Yi. Confucius Poems" Jane 1: "The death of poetry (no) hidden will.

" Poetry " specifically refers to the "Book of Songs". Such as "The Analects. For politics": "Three hundred "Poems", in a word, said: "Thinking is innocent."" "Zhan Guo Ce. "Eastern Zhou Policy": "When there are few officials, recite "Poem", "Poem" says: "Under the whole world, can it be the king's soil; the coast of the earth, can it be the king's minister.""

" Poetry " also expresses conviction. Such as "Book of Rites. "Nei Ze": "For the three days of the birth of the emperor and the son [...], the auspicious one stays in the house, and the auspicious one stays in the house, and the poetry loses it." Zheng Xuan's note: "The poem is also inherited." Kong Yingda Shu: "That I am aspiring to take it with my hands."
humanum_short_description_en: From " words " to " temple " sounds. The original meaning is poetry, a literary genre that expresses emotions through language with rhythm and rhythm.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「寺」聲。戰國楚系文字異體或從「言」，「之」聲，與《說文》古文同。又有從「口」，「之」聲的字形。本義是詩歌，一種文學體裁，通過帶韻律節奏的語言抒發情感。《說文》：「詩，志也。从言，寺聲。𧥳，古文詩省。」段玉裁注引《毛詩序》曰：「詩者，志之所之也。在心為志，發言為詩。」例子如《尚書．金縢》：「公乃為詩以貽王，名之曰〈鴟鴞〉。」《上博一．孔子詩論》簡1：「詩亡（無）隱志。」

　　「詩」又特指《詩經》。如《論語．為政》：「《詩》三百，一言以蔽之，曰：『思無邪。』」《戰國策．東周策》：「臣少而誦《詩》，《詩》曰：『普天之下，莫非王土；率土之濱，莫非王臣。』」

　　「詩」還表示承奉。如《禮記．內則》：「國君世子生[……]三日，卜士負之，吉者宿齋，朝服寢門外，詩負之。」鄭玄注：「詩之言承也。」孔穎達疏：「謂以手承下而抱負之。」
humanum_short_description: 從「言」，「寺」聲。本義是詩歌，一種文學體裁，通過帶韻律節奏的語言抒發情感。

①文學體栽的一種，通過有節奏和韻律的語言反映生活，抒發情感：詩歌。詩話(ａ．評論詩人、詩歌、詩派以及記錄詩人議論、行事的著作；b．古代說唱藝術的一種)。詩集。詩劇。詩篇。詩人。詩章。詩史。吟詩。
②中國古書名，《詩經》的簡稱。

詩(し): poem, verse of poetry
詩人(しじん): poet

從「 言 」，「 寺 」聲。戰國楚系文字異體或從「 言 」，「 之 」聲，與《說文》古文同。又有從「 口 」，「 之 」聲的字形。本義是詩歌，一種文學體裁，通過帶韻律節奏的語言抒發情感。《說文》：「詩，志也。从言，寺聲。𧥳，古文詩省。」段玉裁注引《毛詩序》曰：「詩者，志之所之也。在心為志，發言為詩。」例子如《尚書．金縢》：「公乃為詩以貽王，名之曰〈鴟鴞〉。」《上博一．孔子詩論》簡1：「詩亡（無）隱志。」 「 詩 」又特指《詩經》。如《論語．為政》：「《詩》三百，一言以蔽之，曰：『思無邪。』」《戰國策．東周策》：「臣少而誦《詩》，《詩》曰：『普天之下，莫非王土；率土之濱，莫非王臣。』」 「 詩 」還表示承奉。如《禮記．內則》：「國君世子生[……]三日，卜士負之，吉者宿齋，朝服寢門外，詩負之。」鄭玄注：「詩之言承也。」孔穎達疏：「謂以手承下而抱負之。」
From " words" to " temple" sounds. The characters of Chu in the Warring States Period are different from " yan" and " zhi", which are the same as the ancient text of "Shuowen". There are also glyphs from " kou" and " zhi". The original meaning is poetry, a literary genre that expresses emotions through language with rhythm and rhythm. "Said Wen": "Poetry, will also. Congyan, temple sound. 𧥳, ancient poetry province." Duan Yucai quoted "Mao Poetry Preface" saying: "Poets, where the will is also. The heart is the will. Speaking is poetry." An example is "Shang Shu. "Jin Fei": "Gong is a poem to Yi Wang, the name is "Owl"." "Shanghai Bo Yi. Confucius Poems" Jane 1: "The death of poetry (no) hidden will. " Poetry" specifically refers to the "Book of Songs". Such as "The Analects. For politics": "Three hundred "Poems", in a word, said: "Thinking is innocent."" "Zhan Guo Ce. "Eastern Zhou Policy": "When there are few officials, recite "Poem", "Poem" says: "Under the whole world, can it be the king's soil; the coast of the earth, can it be the king's minister."" " Poetry" also expresses conviction. Such as "Book of Rites. "Nei Ze": "For the three days of the birth of the emperor and the son [...], the auspicious one stays in the house, and the auspicious one stays in the house, and the poetry loses it." Zheng Xuan's note: "The poem is also inherited." Kong Yingda Shu: "That I am aspiring to take it with my hands."

詩字的基本解释

詩
shī
见“诗”。

詩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shī］
［《廣韻》書之切，平之，書。］
“诗1”的繁体字。
(1)文学体裁的一种。通过有节奏、韵律的语言反映生活，抒发情感。最初诗可以唱咏。
(2)指《诗经》。
(3)诵诗；题诗；作诗。
(4)比喻美妙而富于生活情趣或能引发人强烈感情的事物。
(5)记录；记载。
(6)同“邿”。
(7)捧持。
(8)接续；继承。

詩字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　詩； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1157第15
〔古文〕?【唐韻】書之切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】申之切，?始平聲。【說文】志也。【釋名】之也，志之所之也。【書·舜典】詩言志。【傳】心之所之謂之志。心有所之，必形于言，故曰詩言志。【詩·國風·關雎序】在心爲志，發言爲詩。【前漢·藝文志】誦其言，謂之詩。【舊唐書·經籍志】詩以紀興衰誦歡。　又六詩。【周禮·春官·大師】敎六詩。【疏】按詩上下惟有風雅頌是詩之名也。三者之中有比賦興，故總謂之六詩。【鄭康成·六藝論】詩，絃歌諷諭之聲也。朱子曰：風雅頌，聲樂部分之名。賦比興，則所以制作風雅頌之體也。　又樂章也。【荀子·勸學篇】詩者，中聲之所止也。【註】詩謂樂章，所以節聲音，至乎中而止，不使流淫也。　又【類篇】承也，持也。【禮·內則】國君世子生三日，卜士負之，吉者宿齊，朝服寢門外，詩負之。【註】詩之言承也。【疏】《詩含神霧》云：詩者，持也。以手維持，則承奉之義，謂以手承下而抱負之。　又姓。【後漢·南蠻傳】詩索，交阯朱䳒人。　又【字彙補】讀作誅。【荀子·王制篇

poetry
Basic explanation of words
poetry
shī
See "Poem".
poetry
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [shī]
["Guangyun" Book cut, Pingzhi, book. ]
Traditional characters of "诗1".
(1) A genre of literature. Reflect life and express emotions through rhythmic and rhythmic language. At first poems can be sung.
(2) Refers to the "Book of Songs".
(3) Recite poems; write poems; compose poems.
(4) It is a metaphor for things that are beautiful and full of interest in life or can arouse strong emotions.
(5) Record; record.
(6) Same as "邿".
(7) Support.
(8) Succession; inheritance.
poetry
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[You Ji 1] [Words Department] 　Poetry; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1157 No. 15
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] Book cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Club] [Zheng Yun] Shen Zhi cut,? Beginning with a flat sound. [Said Wen] Zhi Ye. 【Release name】It is also the place of the will. 【Book·Shun Dian】Poetry expresses ideals. [Biography] What the heart is called the will. What the heart has, it must be in the form of words, so poetry expresses ambition. 【Poetry·Guofeng·Guanju Preface】The heart is the aspiration, and the speech is the poem. 【Pre-Han·Art and Literature History】Reciting the words is called the poem. [Old Tang Book·Jing Ji Zhi] Poems are chanted in the history of the rise and fall of poems.　 Another six poems. 【Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Master】Six poems. 【Sparse】According to the poem, only Fengya Song is the name of the poem. Among the three, there is Bifuxing, so it is always called the six poems. [Zheng Kangcheng·Six Arts Theory] Poetry, the sound of xiange allegory. Zhu Zi said: Song of Feng Ya, the name of the vocal part. Fu Bixing, so the body of Feng Ya Song is also made.　It's another movement. [Xunzi · Encouraging Learning Chapter] Poetry, where the voice stops. [Note] Poetry is a movement, so the sound of the festival is almost stopped, so that it does not cause adultery.　[Classes] Cheng Ye, Chi Ye. 【Rite·Inner】The monarch’s son was born three days ago, the priest bears it, the auspicious stays in Qi, the court dresses outside the bedroom, and the poetry bears it. [Note] Poetry also has a continuity. [Shu] "The Poetry Contains God's Fog" says: Poet, Chi Ye. To maintain with hands is to embrace the meaning, which means to inherit with hands and aspiration.　Another last name. [Later Han·Nanman Biography] Poetry Suo, addressed to Zhu Yao.　 Also [word complement] pronounced as Zhu. 【Xunzi · King System

shī
вм. 诗
Radicals: 言, 寺  (say, temple)
Meaning Mnemonic
What you say at a temple is a poem. It has to be a poem, because if you say anything else it's just plain disrespectful. All of the monks and priests at this temple have to read and recite poems all day, and if they can do it forever, you can while you're visiting.
Picture all of the people at the temple reciting poems together. You join in too, and it's a really powerful moment!
Reading Mnemonic
As you recite a long poem at the temple you see a sheep (し) in the crowd. It's opening and closing its mouth like it wants to say the poem too.
You turn to the person next to you and realize you have to say everything in poem form.
Excuse me
I'm not a creep
so hear my plea
is that a sheep?
